title: Option::unwrap(): thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value'
body:
The error happens when compiling this code. I tried this code ```rust $ src/main.rs extern crate libinjection; use std::str; use libinjection::{xss}; fn main() { let _b = "OVJtAFc="; let bytes = base64::decode(_b).unwrap(); let _ok = str::from_utf8(&bytes).unwrap(); let _is_ok = xss(_ok).unwrap(); println!("{}", _is_ok); } $ Cargo.toml 1 ⨯ [package] name = "new" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" # See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html [dependencies] libinjection = "0.2" base64 = "0.13.0" ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) binary: rustc commit-hash: db9d1b20bba1968c1ec1fc49616d4742c1725b4b commit-date: 2022-01-20 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ```
Backtrace

``` # cargo run Compiling new v0.1.0 (/home/kali/new) Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.46s Running `target/debug/new` thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', src/main.rs:11:27 stack backtrace: 0: 0x563858ee94dc -
